results.title: Circling the globe in comfort
results.creator_credit: Jaaf Nieuwenhuis and Royal Rotterdam Lloyd
results.brief_description: Historical documentary of a round-the-world trip by the 23,000 ton Dutch liner, the “Willem Ruys”, beginning from Sydney and calling into Wellington (NZ), Lima (Peru), Balboa (Panama City), Miami, Bermuda, Southampton, Rotterdam, passing Portugal, Gibraltar and Malta to Port Said and into the Suez Canal. From the Suez Canal the voyage then continues on through the Red Sea to aden, into the Indian Ocean to Colombo, then Singapore, across the Equator past Java and Christmas Island to Cape Leeuwin and finally arriving in Melbourne.

results.title: Angry Boy
results.creator_credit: Irving Jacoby, Alexander Hammid and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: An analysis of the emotional disturbance of a boy whose hostility finds expression in terms of stealing. Through the help of a child guidance clinic, this hostility is traced back to the source in the home life of the child where a good and well-intentioned mother has been taking out her hostility toward her mother and her husband in an over-protective attitude toward the child. The film then develops as it describes the process in which the child is helped by guidance personnel in his way to recovery. Cinematography by Peter Glushanok.

results.title: Davis Cup, 1956
results.creator_credit: Peter Whitchurch and Ampol Petroleum Ltd
results.brief_description: Edited action footage of all the matches in the 1956 David Cup Final between Australia and USA. Australia won all matches to make it its 13th Davis Cup victory and was represented by Lew Hoad and Ken Rosewall and USA by Victor Seixas, Herbert Flam and Sam Giammalva. Contains footage of historical interest including Robert Menzies in various spectator shots, Harry Hopman receiving Davis cup from Richard Nixon, then Vice President, for 1955 victory.

results.title: Bush and beach around Melbourne
results.brief_description:
This film is made up of various scenes of coastal and bush areas in and around Victoria: life saving display at St. Kilda; some views around the beaches to Portsea; bathers and motor boating across the bay to Queenscliff; into the nearest ranges, fields of daffodils around Healesville, Marysville and Warburton districts; gun-dogs in action; fly-fishing; the Dandenong ranges.
No credits available.

results.title: By Lake and Stream
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: An account of the work being done to maintain the trout population of Victorian lakes and streams. Shows the initial trapping of adult fish, stripping of eggs from the female fish, and subsequent hatching of young fry at the Snob’s Creek hatchery, keeping the young fish in brooding ponds, and finally the release of the trout to replenish lakes and streams. Various trout fishing techniques are demonstrated, and the film concludes with scenes of anglers in action in many parts of the State.

results.title: Bushfire: our summer fate
results.brief_description: Shows how a bushfire in the Blue Mountains on 6 December 1977 caused the death of one person, 70 homes to be destroyed and the evacuation of thousands all in a space of five hours and similarly how the bushfire of summer 1967 in Hobart killed 62 people and destroyed upto 1000 homes and 130 major buildings. Includes a report by scientist David Ellyards on how, where and why bushfires start in Australia followed up by how to prevent death and destruction due to bushfires.

results.title: Australian notebook. No. 3
results.brief_description: Fly fishermen perfect their art for annual assault on trout streams - skill in manipulating the finely woollen line is acquired only after years of patient practice; Australian National Airways take delivery of newest DC-6B airline ‘Beltana’ (arrival at Essendon Airport); Hakoah force Moreland to replay in exciting Dockerty Cup semi-final (soccer).

results.title: Bushland fantasy
results.creator_credit: Soundmasters and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Provides glimpses of the many wild flowers and animals found in the Australian bush. Includes photographs of native flora, and animal life such as kangaroos, wallabies, platypus, lyrebirds and koalas. Many of these can be found in the wildlife sanctuary at Healesville where special efforts are made to arrange a proper diet for these animals. Narrated by John Dudley.
